key_points: Afghanistan has witnessed the collapse of its government and the takeover by the Taliban.
Agnes Callamard, Amnesty International’s Secretary General, describes the situation as a preventable tragedy.
There's an urgent call for the international community to act to prevent further crises.
At risk individuals including academics, journalists, and women human rights defenders face danger under Taliban rule.
Foreign governments are urged to facilitate safe passage for those at risk and to suspend deportations.
The US is specifically urged to provide continued security at Kabul airport to aid evacuations.
The UN Security Council is called upon to adopt a resolution demanding the Taliban respect international human rights.
Thousands are trying to flee Afghanistan through Kabul airport amid chaotic scenes.
All commercial flights from Kabul airport have been suspended, with US troops overseeing evacuation efforts.
There have been reported fatalities at Kabul airport amid the chaos.
